title: Calories in a Grilled Salmon Fillet
meta_description: Discover calories in a grilled salmon fillet, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g, and preparation tweaks for your diet.
h1: Calories in a Grilled Salmon Fillet
assumptions: One standard 150 g fillet, skinless, grilled without added oil or seasonings; wild or farmed Atlantic salmon.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by salmon type (wild vs. farmed), size, cooking method, and additions like oil or sauce. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A 150 g grilled salmon fillet provides ~309 kcal and ~33 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during grilling

faqs.q: How many calories in a grilled salmon fillet?
faqs.a: About 309 kcal for a 150 g skinless fillet grilled without oil.

faqs.q: What's the protein in grilled salmon?
faqs.a: Approximately 33 g protein per 150 g fillet.
No carbs; it's primarily protein and healthy fats.
Wild is slightly lower (~182 kcal/100 g) due to less fat; farmed ~206 kcal/100 g.

faqs.q: How does grilling affect salmon nutrition?
faqs.a: Grilling preserves nutrients but adds minimal calories unless oil is used; avoids extra fats from frying.
